subtask.title: Define AI Agents and Sequential Prompts
subtask.objective: Clarify the definitions, capabilities, and limitations of AI agents and sequential prompts in the context of automation and decision-making.
subtask.scope: Differentiate AI agents (autonomous systems with goal-oriented behavior) from sequential prompts (structured, multi-step instructions using prompting techniques).

verification.completion_summary: The research addressed definitions and capabilities of AI agents (e.g., automation of 'long tail' tasks, LLM integration) and touched on sequential prompts via mentions of multi-step workflows. However, limitations of both concepts were not explicitly analyzed, and the scope's differentiation between AI agents and sequential prompts lacked explicit contrast.

covered_aspects: Capabilities of AI agents (e.g., web scraping, market research)
Mentions of sequential prompts as multi-step processes
missing_aspects: Explicit differentiation between AI agents and sequential prompts

missing_requirements: Analysis of limitations for AI agents and sequential prompts
Clear comparative framework between AI agents and sequential prompts
